<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Visual Fidelity](/Feats.aspx?ID=3063) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Inventor" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=408" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 27</row>

</column>

---

You've found a way to use a hodgepodge combination of devices to enhance your visual abilities in every situation. You gain [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415) and [low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416), and you can see [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) creatures and objects as translucent shapes, though these shapes are indistinct enough to be [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) to you.

 If an effect would give you the [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) condition, the effect must attempt a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check against your class DC, with your counteract level equaling half your level, rounded up. On a failed counteract check, you aren't blinded—your various devices are able to compensate.
name: Visual Fidelity
